info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 24 at 4:29PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Routt County through 500 PM MDT... At 428 PM MDT, meteorologists and satellite imagery were tracking a strong thunderstorm near Yampa, or 44 miles northeast of Glenwood Springs, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, heavy rainfall, and pea size hail. SOURCE...Satellite imagery. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Routt County, including the following locations... Toponas. This includes the following highways... Colorado 131 between mile markers 27 and 41. Colorado 134 between mile markers 1 and 10. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
